ST - S - Rib & Infill Installation
Pre-commencement
Infill Panel SWMS compiled and provided to Ryman for review prior to work starting on site
Ribs inspected on arrival and correct (length, width, size/shape) as per design/shop drawings and damage free
Rib lifting plan confirmed, correct chains and hooks verified.
Infill boards inspected on arrival. No knots, no cracks or other weaknesses across 25% of the width.
Propping layout confirmed as "issued for construction" and attached.
Area cleared for propping to be erected in place.
Structural Steel Brackets fitted and fixed (correct height and as per design)
Propping/Falseworks
Floor area cleared for propping to be erected.
Props tagged and fixings as per approved design.
U Head brackets rotated to support bearers, bearers clipped to U head brackets.
All back propping completed, checked and approved as per design
Rib Installation
Inspect against rib install and propping layout drawings. Mark up hard copy drawings accordingly and upload to this checkpoint to verify the specification has been met.
No visual damage to ribs
SWMS implemented and followed.
Ryman Foreman Sign off to receive Rib Installation inspection results. Pass this checkpoint after sending the email.
CLICK AND SEND EMAIL TO RYMAN FOREMAN TO SIGN FOR RECEIPT OF THE INSPECTION RESULTS
Infill Panel Installation
Infill boards tightly constructed as panels, including 'backbone', 6 to 10 boards in length.
Infill panels fitted tightly between ribs.
Infill panel adjacent ends are joined.
Infill panels locked with timber blocks to prevent lateral movement.
Infill boards secured to wall supports
No obvious visual defects on infill boards, no knots, no cracks or other weakness across 25% of the width.
All gaps filled, infills installed, PF rod/expanding foam installed (No gaps)
Ryman Foreman Sign off to receive Rib Installation inspection results. Pass this checkpoint after sending the email.

Steel Portal - Ref:
Pre-commencement
Hold down bolts in the correct location
Pre erection checks complete
Installation
Steel correct size and type
Welding certificates sited
Installed in the correct location and orientation
Installed in correct level, plumb, correct pitch and braced
All bolts secure/ correctly tensioned
All structural steel correctly installed in respective area and acceptable
Post-Installation
Welding Visual/Scanning inspections completed
Chemical anchor proof tests conducted on the sample selected by the MV Engineer
Chemical anchors are tested to 0.7xdesign load
The test load of the bar is provided by the MV Engineer
Proof load tests maintained for a minimum of 30 seconds
The load did not drop more than 10% during the testing

If the proof of tests show failure of the anchors, installation of anchors should stop, cause of failure investigated and installation methodology should be reviewed. If failure is recorded, the minimum test sample shall be increased to 6 specimens or 5% of the total relevant anchor population, whichever is greater.
Mechanical anchor testing conducted on the sample selected by the MV Engineer and witnessed by the MV Engineer
For trubolt or similar anchors the maximum tightening torque is reviewed

If the proof of tests show failure of the anchors, installation of anchors should stop, cause of failure investigated and installation methodology should be reviewed. If failure is recorded, the minimum test sample shall be increased to 6 specimens or 5% of the total relevant anchor population, whichever is greater.
Inspections completed and issued to Foreman
CLICK AND SEND EMAIL TO FOREMAN TO SIGN FOR RECEIPT OF THE INSPECTION RESULTS
